etymology.description: 尒 is a variant form of 爾(爾) (ěr, 'you') with the original depiction of a cloth on a loom (檷) -> borrowed phonetically for 'you'
etymology.interpretation: The character 尒 is a simplified variant of 爾(爾) (ěr, 'you') representing a cloth on a loom, which was later borrowed for its phonetic sound to denote 'you'.
etymology.simplification: 尒 is the simplified form adopted from 爾(爾) (ěr, 'you'). It represents an abridged version for ease in writing as part of the Chinese Character Simplification Scheme.

examples.chinese: 他的尒非常敏锐(他的尒非常敏銳)。
他静静聆听(他靜靜聆聽)，通过尒捕捉微弱的声音(通過尒捕捉微弱的聲音)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jìngjìng língtīng, tōngguò ěr bǔzhuō wēiruò de shēngyīn.
examples.english: He listens quietly, capturing faint sounds through his ear.
